intro: Bunchosia columbica, commonly known as the Colombian bunchosia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a hairy texture. Bunchosia columbica is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
